transportAdvice: Corfu Town's old town is walkable, but reaching beaches and villages across the island requires transport; a public bus network connects major towns and resorts, though services can be infrequent outside peak season. Taxis are widely available, and renting a car or scooter is a popular and practical option for exploring the island independently.

weather.description: Cool and wet with frequent rain showers; the island is quiet and uncrowded, suited for sightseeing rather than beach activities.
Still cool and rainy with occasional mild spells; lush green landscapes begin to emerge but beach weather is far off.
Temperatures begin to rise and rain becomes less frequent; pleasant for walking and exploring historic sites.
Spring brings warm, sunny days with occasional showers; wildflowers bloom and the island feels fresh and uncrowded.
Warm and mostly sunny with very little rain; ideal conditions for sightseeing and early-season swimming.
Hot and reliably sunny; beach season is in full swing and the sea is comfortably warm for swimming.
Peak summer heat with long sunny days and virtually no rain; expect busy beaches and lively resort areas.
Equally hot and sunny as July; the busiest tourist month with warm sea temperatures perfect for water activities.
Warm and still very sunny with the sea retaining summer warmth; crowds thin out making it an excellent time to visit.
Mild and pleasant with increasing cloud cover and occasional rain; good for hiking and cultural exploration.
Noticeably cooler with regular rainfall; most beach resorts close but the island remains accessible and peaceful.
Cool and wet with short days; Corfu Town has a quiet charm in winter but outdoor and beach activities are not viable.
